result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lemar William Howze

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lemar William Howze appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan appeared by video for Lemar William Howze.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 18CF5134. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective C. Donahue. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lemar William Howze not in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defense Counsel in another court and unable to appear. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from defendant re:  status of previously filed motions.  (Lemar W. Howze - #2022006789, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a prelimnary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Flanagan needs more time to meet with client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Lemar W. Howze - #2022006789, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Speedy Trial.  (Lemar W. Howze - #2022006789, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Motion to Dismiss from Defendant ( Lemar Howze # 202200679- House of Correction 8885 S 68th St Franklin, WI 53132)

Defendant Lemar William Howze not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lemar William Howze not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminar hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with VIC, RJS, Victor's Lounge and Kevin Oliver.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lemar William Howze in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Lemar William Howze in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
